comment.author: 43372015@N02
comment._content: It would nice if the images had a date,great scene from Killarney.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: I know! We've dated where we can, but closest for this one is 1890-ish. Hoping that someone may recognise a shop sign, etc. that can help us be more exact...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 63638916@N06
comment._content: Looks like the camera was standing just to the right of the top of what's now Plunkett Street, looking north east towards the steeple of the town's Franciscan Friary.  The wall and trees on the left have been knocked down to make way for a carpark (with clampers).

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: BOO (to the cutting down of the trees), not your comment!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 78238283@N03
comment._content: Great look back into history. I agree with robindch. It was taken here looking maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,496629,590710,7,9 just east of Henn St. (now Plunket St) This 25 inch mapping series (1:2,500) was surveyed between 1888-1913 and are great for locating old photos...you could get lost in them PS the wall and and trees also seem to be shown in the 6 inch mapping series layer (1:10,560) colour surveyed between 1837-1842
